shortdescription: IBIT shatters all records as institutional adoption accelerates beyond expectations.
author: Emma Chen

content.content: BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) has become the most successful ETF launch in financial history, reaching $100 billion in assets under management less than two years after its January 2024 debut. The milestone cements Bitcoin's position as a mainstream institutional asset class, with IBIT alone now holding approximately 4.5% of all Bitcoin ever mined. Daily trading volume regularly exceeds $5 billion, making it one of the most liquid ETFs in the world. BlackRock CEO Larry Fink, once a Bitcoin skeptic, called it 'the fastest-growing investment product in the history of finance.' According to Wall Street Journal, pension funds, endowments, and sovereign wealth funds now collectively hold over $200 billion in spot Bitcoin ETFs. The combined spot Bitcoin ETF market has surpassed gold ETFs in total AUM, representing a historic shift in how investors view digital assets.

The success of Bitcoin ETFs has fundamentally changed portfolio construction for institutional investors. The traditional 60/40 stock/bond portfolio is increasingly becoming 55/35/10 with Bitcoin as the third asset class. Major wealth management platforms including Morgan Stanley, Merrill Lynch, and UBS now offer Bitcoin ETF allocations as standard options in client portfolios. Analysis by Financial Times shows that portfolios with 5-10% Bitcoin allocation have outperformed traditional portfolios by 3-5% annually with only marginally higher volatility. The institutional stamp of approval has also attracted retail investors, with Robinhood and Fidelity reporting record Bitcoin ETF purchases from self-directed IRA accounts. Bitcoin's correlation with traditional assets has decreased significantly, reinforcing its role as a portfolio diversifier and digital store of value.
